2.speaker: PENGUIN
2.japanese: 今更の話 していいかな？
2.english: There's something that I've been wondering... Yes?

4.speaker: PENGUIN
4.japanese: どうやって イスに座るの？

5.speaker: LLAMA
5.japanese: ペンギンさんに言われたくないですよ
5.english: I'd rather not hear that from you.

6.speaker: GENTOO
6.japanese: それでは 営業会議を始めます
6.english: All right, let's start our sales meeting.

7.speaker: GENTOO
7.english: The subject is... in regard to a possible promotion to help sell the overwhelming amount of leftover penguin cards.

8.speaker: ADELIE
8.japanese: クリスマスにも正月にも あまり動かなかったしね
8.english: We didn't have much luck during Christmas or New Year's, either.

9.speaker: CHINSTRAP
9.japanese: だから そんなに 作らなくていいって言ったのに
9.english: I told you we didn't need to make so many. We have a large percentage of Penguins today.

10.speaker: POLAR BEAR
10.japanese: そうだね うち 今 生魚フェア 真っ最中だからね
10.english: Looks like it. I guess it's because we're right in the middle of our raw fish fair.

12.speaker: ADELIE
12.japanese: 売れると思ったんだよ…

13.speaker: CHINSTRAP
13.japanese: まったく… キミは勢いだけなんだから
13.english: Jeez, all you have going for you is enthusiasm. I wonder what the penguin cards are.

15.speaker: SASAKO
15.japanese: 説明する気 ないですよね
15.english: I guess you don't feel like explaining.

17.speaker: GENTOO
17.japanese: とにかく 抱えた在庫を なんとかしないと！
17.english: Anyway, we have to do something with the stock we already have. All right. Let's start throwing out ideas.

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: ペンギンさんたち 熱心に相談してるね
18.english: The penguins seem to be having an impassioned discussion.

19.speaker: PANDA
19.japanese: それに比べて こっちのペンギンさんは 特に熱心でもなく
19.english: And then we have you, a penguin who's not very impassioned

20.speaker: PANDA
20.japanese: ただ コーヒーを飲んでるだけだね
20.english: and just sits there drinking his coffee. Could you not describe the free time  I treat myself to like that?

24.speaker: PANDA
24.japanese: えっと… たしか ピ…
24.english: Um, let's see, it was P—

25.speaker: ADELIE
25.japanese: 僕たち ピゴセリス属です

26.speaker: ADELIE
26.japanese: 南極の恋人 アデリーペンギンです
26.english: I'm the lover of the South Pole, Adélie penguin.

27.speaker: CHINSTRAP
27.japanese: 渋めで地味めな アゴヒモペンギンです
27.english: I'm stoic and modest, Chinstrap penguin. I have a stylish personality, Gentoo penguin.

28.speaker: THREE
28.english: The three of us make up...

30.speaker: THREE
30.english: The three of us make up...

31.speaker: PANDA
31.english: P— The Pygoscelis genus! Ah. There's an easy way to remember it.

33.speaker: POLAR BEAR
33.japanese: ゴヴダゲアイドヌーのゴに…

34.speaker: PENGUIN
34.english: You're actually making it harder to remember.

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: 何その ゴヴなんとか…

36.speaker: POLAR BEAR
36.japanese: ノルウェーの村でしょ
36.english: It's a village in Norway, of course.

38.japanese: 知ってる前提で話すの やめて
38.english: Would you not say it like I was supposed to know?

39.speaker: SASAKO
39.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

40.speaker: PENGUIN
40.japanese: 何？ 珍しいね 笹子さんから
40.english: What is it? That's rare coming from you, Miss Sasako.

41.speaker: SASAKO
41.japanese: ちょっと 今日 ペンギンさんが 多すぎて ややこしいですね
41.english: There are so many Penguins today that it's a bit confusing.

42.speaker: PENGUIN
42.japanese: そんなに多くないでしょ…
42.english: There aren't that many... Stay behind the counter.

46.speaker: PENGUIN
46.japanese: 僕 いいのかな？ こういうことで
46.english: Is it really okay for me to be here?

47.speaker: ADELIE
47.japanese: とにかく 遊び方を提案しなきゃ
47.english: First of all, we have to figure out a way to play with these.

50.speaker: GENTOO
50.japanese: トレーディングカード風にしてみる？
50.english: How about making them like trading cards?

51.speaker: CHINSTRAP
51.japanese: 自分で言うのも なんだけど

52.speaker: CHINSTRAP
52.japanese: トレーディングのしがいがないな
52.english: but there really isn't any point to trading them.

53.speaker: ADELIE
53.japanese: そんなに 種類ないしね
53.english: There just aren't that many kinds.

54.speaker: ADELIE
54.japanese: そうだ！バレンタインデーの チョコ贈る習慣みたいにさ
54.english: I know! You know how people give chocolates on Valentine's Day? Yeah.

55.speaker: ADELIE
55.japanese: 恋人が ペンギンカードを贈る日を 作ったら どうかな？
55.english: Why don't we make a day where people give penguin cards?

59.speaker: SASAKO
59.japanese: いらないかもしれません
59.english: I don't think I'd want one.

60.speaker: CHINSTRAP
60.english: A St. Penguin's Day? Or the card in general.

62.speaker: ADELIE
62.japanese: なんてこと 言うんだ！
62.english: How can you say such a thing?!

63.speaker: ADELIE
63.japanese: コーヒー運んでばっかりいないで 何か アイディアないかな！？
63.english: How about you stop carrying around coffee and come up with ideas?!

67.speaker: GENTOO
67.english: Yes? What about the train station?

68.speaker: SASAKO
68.japanese: 駅前で ポケットティッシュと 一緒に配るのは どうでしょう？
68.english: How about giving them away with tissues in front of the train station?

69.speaker: SASAKO
69.japanese: どうぞ～ お願いしま～す
69.english: Here you go. Thank you for your patronage.

71.speaker: CHINSTRAP
71.japanese: ポケットティッシュ付けないと もらってもらえないほど 魅力ないカードかな！？
71.english: Are you saying that these cards are so worthless, they need to be handed out with tissues?!

72.speaker: SASAKO
72.english: I'm sorry. How about you add a handshake ticket, as well as a voting ticket for the Penguin election?

73.speaker: GENTOO
73.japanese: 全体的に意味がわからないよ

74.speaker: POLAR BEAR
74.japanese: そうだ！ カードを折れば…
74.english: Oh, I know. If you fold the card...

76.speaker: PANDA
76.japanese: 使い捨てのくつべらだね

81.speaker: GENTOO
81.japanese: キミたち 仕事に戻っていいよ
81.english: You guys can go back to work now.

82.speaker: GENTOO
82.japanese: さて 営業会議を続けるわけだけど…
82.english: We'll now be continuing our sales meeting...

83.speaker: GENTOO
83.japanese: キミは戻らないんだね
83.english: I see that you're still here. Why do you have penguin cards, anyway?

84.speaker: GENTOO
84.japanese: ペンギンの種類を覚えてほしくて 作ったんですけどね
84.english: Well, we wanted people to learn the different types of penguins.

85.speaker: ADELIE
85.japanese: ほら！ ペンギン好きな人は多いのに
85.english: You know! Many people love penguins,

86.speaker: ADELIE
86.japanese: 種類となると大雑把でしょ？
86.english: but when it comes to the types, they have no idea.

87.speaker: CHINSTRAP
87.japanese: ペンギンだって 生態や性格は いろいろなわけですよ
87.english: Penguins have various appearances and personalities. All of them are completely different.

88.speaker: PANDA
88.english: Then can any of you fly?

89.speaker: GENTOO
89.japanese: そこまでは 全然違わないけどさ…
89.english: Well, we're all alike in that aspect....

90.speaker: CHINSTRAP
90.japanese: 卵が楕円形のものもいれば 洋ナシ型のものもいるし…
90.english: Some of us lay elliptical eggs, and some lay pear-shaped eggs. Yes, yes.

91.speaker: PANDA
91.japanese: だいたいじゃダメなの？
91.english: Can they be about the same?

92.speaker: ADELIE
92.english: No. Why don't you target little children?

93.speaker: ADELIE
93.japanese: どうだろう？ このカード…
93.english: So, what do you think of this card?

95.speaker: PANDA
95.english: They don't want to look at them today.

96.speaker: PANDA
96.japanese: これ 同じのが何枚もあるよ？
96.english: There are lots of the same cards.

97.speaker: GENTOO
97.japanese: いいえ 全部違います

98.speaker: PANDA
98.japanese: この２枚も違う種類なの？
98.english: Are these two different species, too?

99.speaker: CHINSTRAP
99.japanese: こっちは ロイヤルペンギンで
99.english: This one is a Royal penguin,

100.speaker: CHINSTRAP
100.japanese: こっちは マカロニペンギンです
100.english: and this one is a Macaroni penguin.

101.speaker: ADELIE
101.japanese: ロイヤルペンギンは顔が白いから わかりやすいですよ
101.english: You can easily tell because the Royal penguins have white faces.

103.speaker: GENTOO
103.japanese: フンボルトペンギンとマゼランペンギンです
103.english: That is a Humboldt penguin and a Magellanic penguin.

104.speaker: GENTOO
104.japanese: 胸の筋が１本か２本かで 見分けられます！
104.english: You can tell them apart by the stripe on their chest. Is there a reason to tell them apart?

105.speaker: GENTOO
105.japanese: あるでしょ！フンボルトペンギンとマゼランペンギンだよ！
105.english: Of course there is! It's a Humboldt penguin and a Magellanic penguin!

107.speaker: PANDA
107.japanese: 何？ やっぱり捨てちゃう？
107.english: What? Did you want to throw them away after all?

108.speaker: ADELIE
108.japanese: 違うよ！ なんで 捨てなきゃいけないの！
108.english: No! Why would we throw them away?!

109.speaker: ADELIE
109.english: I just got a great idea!

110.speaker: ADELIE
110.japanese: 神経衰弱とか どうかな？
110.english: How about playing Memory with them?

112.speaker: ADELIE
112.japanese: ペンギンカード２セット使ってね
112.english: You use two decks of Penguin cards,

113.speaker: ADELIE
113.japanese: 同じ種類のペンギンが出たら 当たり
113.english: and if you get two of the same card, you win.

114.speaker: ADELIE
114.japanese: そしたら 覚えてもらえるんじゃない？
114.english: Maybe that'll help people tell us apart. Good idea!

116.speaker: PANDA
116.english: So you have to buy two decks?

117.speaker: ADELIE
117.japanese: そうですけど 何か？

118.speaker: PANDA
118.japanese: ２セット買うのは抵抗あるな
118.english: I'd be reluctant to buy two decks.

119.speaker: ADELIE
119.japanese: もう！ じゃ いいよ！ ２個で１個の値段でいいよ！
119.english: All right, fine! We'll make it two for the price of one!

120.speaker: ADELIE
120.japanese: 早速 試してみましょう
120.english: Let's go ahead and give it a try.

122.speaker: ADELIE
122.japanese: さぁ パンダさん 引いてみてください
122.english: Now, Mr. Panda, pick a card.

123.speaker: PANDA
123.japanese: え～っと… 最初のは コウテイさん
123.english: Let's see... The first one is... The Emperor.

124.speaker: PANDA
124.english: And the second one is... This one. Oh! I got a mat—

126.speaker: PANDA
126.japanese: ません 全然違った

127.speaker: PANDA
127.english: The second one was the King. I think if you look at the patterns and size, you can tell them apart more easily.

128.speaker: CHINSTRAP
128.japanese: 模様とか… 大きさの違いを見てください！
128.english: Please look at the patterns... ...and the difference in size.

129.speaker: PANDA
129.japanese: あっ 今度は当たった
129.english: Oh! This time I got a match! Yay!

130.speaker: GENTOO
130.japanese: 惜しい！ スネアーズペンギンと フィヨルドランドペンギンです
130.english: So close! That's a Snares penguin and a Fiordland penguin.

131.speaker: CHINSTRAP
131.japanese: これはよく似ていて 間違えますね
131.english: Those two do look rather similar, so they are easy to mistake.

133.speaker: CHINSTRAP
133.japanese: ケープペンギンとガラパゴスペンギンでした
133.english: That's a Cape penguin and a Galapagos penguin.

135.speaker: CHINSTRAP
135.japanese: イワトビペンギンとシュレーターペンギンです
135.english: That's a Rockhopper penguin and an Erect-crested penguin.

136.speaker: ADELIE
136.english: So close! You've almost got it!

137.speaker: PANDA
137.japanese: おもしろいのかなこれ

138.speaker: ADELIE
138.japanese: おもしろいじゃないですか

141.speaker: POLAR BEAR
141.japanese: キガシラペンギンって どこかにいたよね
141.english: There was a Yellow-eyed penguin somewhere, wasn't there?

142.speaker: LLAMA
142.japanese: このへんじゃありませんでした

145.speaker: POLAR BEAR
145.japanese: コガタペンギンと イワトビペンギンか
145.english: I got a Little penguin and a Rockhopper penguin.

147.speaker: LLAMA
147.japanese: じゃあ 僕いきます

151.speaker: GENTOO
151.japanese: よし この線で動こう
151.english: All right! Let's go with this.

152.speaker: ADELIE
152.japanese: 早速 営業にいってきます！
152.english: We're going to go sell now.

153.speaker: SASAKO
153.japanese: ありがとうございました

154.speaker: LLAMA
154.japanese: これは わかりづらいですね
154.english: These are hard to tell apart.

155.speaker: POLAR BEAR
155.japanese: わかりづらさがいけてるよね
155.english: But that's what makes it fun. This is a game for grown-ups.

156.speaker: POLAR BEAR
156.japanese: わかりづらいから 何時間でも遊べるよ
156.english: It's hard to tell them apart, so you can play for hours.

157.speaker: LLAMA
157.japanese: とにかく わかりづらいですね
157.english: With extra emphasis on the hard part. I wonder how good of a game that would be.

158.speaker: PENGUIN
158.japanese: パンダくん パンダくん

159.speaker: PENGUIN
159.japanese: そろそろ僕出てきてもいいかな
159.english: Is it okay if I come out now? Oh! Where were you, Mr. Penguin?

160.speaker: PANDA
160.japanese: そんなところにいないで こっちに来なよ
160.english: Don't just stand there. Come join us!

161.speaker: PENGUIN
161.japanese: うん その気持はありがたいけど

162.speaker: PENGUIN
162.japanese: そんなところにいたのは キミに言われたからだけど
162.english: but the reason I came over here is because you told to.

163.speaker: PENGUIN
163.english: I guess there's no point in bringing it up.

164.speaker: BABIES
164.japanese: ピピーッ 到着します 到着します！
164.english: Beep, beep! We are arriving! We are arriving!

166.speaker: POLAR BEAR
166.english: Do you want another café mocha?

169.speaker: SASAKO
169.japanese: ペンギンさん いつものでいいですか
169.english: Would you like your usual, Mr. Penguin?

171.speaker: POLAR BEAR
171.japanese: じゃあ すごいの出しちゃおう
171.english: Then I'll totally bring out something amazing!

176.speaker: PENGUIN
176.japanese: シロクマくん 明日の日曜日 ピクニックに行かない？
176.english: Do you want to go on a picnic tomorrow, Polar Bear? Sorry, I have plans to go mini golfing tomorrow.

177.speaker: PENGUIN
177.japanese: じゃあ 笹子さんは

186.speaker: PENGUIN
186.japanese: いいから 「うん」って言って！
186.english: It doesn't matter. Just say yes!

187.speaker: PENGUIN
187.japanese: キミのいろいろなムチャに つき合ってきた仲でしょ
187.english: I've done tons of ridiculous things for you!

189.speaker: PANDA
189.japanese: いきなり 「うん」だなんて言えないよ

190.speaker: PENGUIN
190.english: Is this really where you get embarrassed?

191.speaker: PENGUIN
191.english: What am I going to do?

194.speaker: PENGUIN
194.japanese: 今まで ペン子さんたちに 追いまわされてきたわけだけど
194.english: I've been chased by the Penkos all this time... {\a6}Mr. Penguin! {\a6}Wait up!

196.speaker: PENKO
196.japanese: それで… 誰が好きなの？
196.english: So... Who do you really like?

197.speaker: POLAR BEAR
197.japanese: それは追い詰められたね
197.english: They've really got you in a corner.

198.speaker: PENGUIN
198.english: It's true. I've never had such a tasteless coffee in my life.

199.speaker: SASAKO
199.english: I can imagine. So, Mr. Penguin, how did you answer?

200.speaker: PENGUIN
200.english: Well... I like you all! I can't choose!

201.speaker: PENGUIN
201.english: I like you all! That's pretty awful, Mr. Penguin.

202.speaker: PENGUIN
202.japanese: けど 他に言いようがなかったよ あのシチュエーションでは…
202.english: But there's nothing else I could have said in that situation.

204.speaker: PENGUIN
204.japanese: つきあうことになったんだよ

210.speaker: PENGUIN
210.japanese: なんたって ７人と まんべんなく デートしなくちゃ ならないんだからね
210.english: Because I have to date all seven of them equally.

211.speaker: SASAKO
211.japanese: それは… 大変ですね

212.speaker: PENGUIN
212.japanese: うん 大変なんだけどさ…

214.speaker: PENGUIN
214.japanese: そういえば ペン子さん

215.speaker: PENJOLINA
215.japanese: えっ… 私 ペンジョリーナよ！
215.english: What? I'm Penjolina! S-Sorry! Um, Miss Penko? I'm Penna!

216.speaker: PENGUIN
216.japanese: えっ… えっと ペン子さんは…

217.speaker: PENGUIN
217.japanese: ７人の区別が つかないんだよね！
217.english: I can't tell the seven of them apart!

218.speaker: SASAKO
218.english: It must be hard. It is hard.

219.speaker: PENGUIN
219.japanese: でも どうしても 名前と顔が覚えられないんだ
219.english: I can't put their faces with their names, no matter how hard I try.

220.speaker: PENKO
220.japanese: 何よ 失礼しちゃう！ 名前くらい覚えてよ！！
220.english: How rude! You should at least remember our names!

221.speaker: SASAKO
221.japanese: けど あんなに 好きだ 好きだ 言ってたのに
221.english: You always said how much you liked them,

222.speaker: SASAKO
222.japanese: 顔も覚えていないんですか？
222.english: and you still don't remember their faces?

223.speaker: PENGUIN
223.japanese: 好きなのと 顔が区別できるのは 別の話じゃないかな？
223.english: I think liking them, and being able to tell them apart are two different things.

224.speaker: POLAR BEAR
224.japanese: 無理あるよね その理屈
224.english: There's a flaw in that reasoning somewhere.

225.speaker: PENGUIN
225.japanese: どうしたら いいんだろう…

226.speaker: PENGUIN
226.japanese: しかも 明日 ピクニックに行くんだよ！
226.english: Not to mention, I have to go on a picnic tomorrow! All by your lonesome?

227.speaker: PENGUIN
227.japanese: そんなわけないでしょ！ 流れ 読んでよ！
227.english: Of course not! Can't you see the flow here?

228.speaker: PENGUIN
228.english: I'm going with the Penkos! It'll be very lively!

229.speaker: PENGUIN
229.japanese: だから 誰か一緒に行って

230.japanese: 耳もとで 誰が誰か ささやいてくれないかな
230.english: and whisper in my ear who's who? Like the owner of a traditional Japanese restaurant would.

231.speaker: SASAKO
231.english: Who might you be referring to? All right. I'll go.

233.speaker: POLAR BEAR
233.english: All right! I'll do my best.

235.speaker: PENGUIN
235.japanese: 困ったな… どうすれば覚えられるんだろう？
235.english: What should I do? How can I remember them all?

236.speaker: POLAR BEAR
236.japanese: 名札 つけてもらったら？
236.english: Why don't you have them wear name tags?

237.speaker: PENGUIN
237.japanese: レディーに 胸元に 名札つけてなんて頼めないよ
237.english: I can't ask a lady to pin a name tag on her chest. That wouldn't be very good.

239.speaker: PANDA
239.japanese: ペン子さんたちに 何か しゃべる前に
239.english: Why don't you have the Penkos

240.speaker: PANDA
240.japanese: 名前を言ってもらえば いいんじゃない？

242.speaker: PENNA
242.japanese: そろそろ お弁当にしましょう
242.english: How about we have lunch now?

243.speaker: PENGUIN
243.japanese: そうだね ペン乃ちゃん

244.speaker: PENJOLINA
244.japanese: はい ペンジョリーナです

246.speaker: PENGUIN
246.japanese: ありがとう ペンジョリーナちゃん

247.speaker: PENGUIN
247.japanese: いいね そのシステム
247.english: I like it! That system is great! But there's a flaw.

248.speaker: SASAKO
248.japanese: ペン子さんたちに そんなこと頼めるんですか？
248.english: Would you really be able to ask them to do that?

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.english: I wonder how I should go about asking them.

251.speaker: PANDA
251.japanese: 区別つかないから 名前 言ってって頼めばいいよ
251.english: Just say you can't tell them apart and then ask them for their names.

252.speaker: PENGUIN
252.japanese: そんなこと言ったら 大変な目に遭うよ！
252.english: If I actually said that, I'd be in a lot of trouble!

255.speaker: PENGUIN
255.japanese: って シロクマくんが 名乗るんじゃ ダメでしょ！
255.english: There's no point in you naming yourself!

256.speaker: SASAKO
256.japanese: あっ こういうのは？

257.speaker: PENGUIN
257.english: What? How about you haveeach of the Penkos wear a different colored ribbon?

258.speaker: SASAKO
258.japanese: 誰が何色ってふうにしたら 覚えられませんか？
258.english: If they each have a color, wouldn't it be easier to remember them?

259.speaker: PENGUIN
259.japanese: ペン子ちゃん ペン美ちゃん

260.speaker: SASAKO
260.japanese: ねっ！ こうすれば区別できませんか？
260.english: See? Wouldn't you be able to tell them apart then?

261.speaker: PENGUIN
261.japanese: それだ！ それなら覚えられる！
261.english: That's it! Then I can remember them!

262.speaker: PENGUIN
262.japanese: ありがとう 笹子さん！

263.speaker: PENGUIN
263.japanese: ノーベルリボン賞あげたいよ！
263.english: I'd like to give you the Nobel Ribbon Award!

264.speaker: PENGUIN
264.japanese: ありがとう みんな 今日は もう帰るよ。
264.english: Thanks, guys! I'm going home now.

265.speaker: PENGUIN
265.japanese: 名前 頑張って覚えるから！ それじゃ！
265.english: I'm going to do my best to remember their names! See ya!

266.speaker: SASAKO
266.english: Not only could he not tell their faces apart,

267.speaker: SASAKO
267.japanese: ７人の名前さえも まだ覚えてなかったんですね
267.english: but apparently he still doesn't know all their names yet. Seems so.

268.speaker: PANDA
268.japanese: 笹子さん 明日のバイト代わってくれない？
268.english: Will you work for me tomorrow, Miss Sasako?

269.speaker: SASAKO
269.japanese: 私が？ パンダくんの代わりに 動物園に行くの？
269.english: You want me to go to the zoo in your place?

270.speaker: POLAR BEAR
270.japanese: カフェなら大丈夫だよ
270.english: You don't have to worry about the café.

272.speaker: SASAKO
272.japanese: そういう問題じゃないですよ
272.english: I don't think that's the issue. Just thinking about how troublesome work will be tomorrow

273.speaker: PANDA
273.japanese: 今日をダラダラ生きられないよ
273.english: has made me too exhausted to move today.

275.speaker: SASAKO
275.japanese: そういえば 昨日のペンギンさんのピクニック どうだったんですかね？
275.english: By the way, I'm curious how Mr. Penguin's picnic went yesterday.

276.speaker: POLAR BEAR
276.english: Are you okay? How did your ribbon strategy go?

278.speaker: PENGUIN
278.japanese: 僕から みんなに プレゼントがあるんだ！
278.english: I have a present for all of you!

280.speaker: PENGUIN
280.japanese: はい ペン子ちゃん！

282.speaker: PENGUIN
282.japanese: はい ペン奈ちゃん。

283.speaker: PENNA
283.japanese: ありがとう わぁ～ きれい
283.english: Thank you. Oh, how pretty! Look! Look! Penmi.

284.speaker: BG
284.japanese: ありがとう とっても嬉しい！
284.english: It'll totally look good on you!

285.speaker: PENMI
285.japanese: ありがとう とっても嬉しい！

286.speaker: PENGUIN
286.japanese: 色と名前を 関連付けて覚えていったんだ
286.english: I made sure to remember which name matched which color.

287.speaker: SASAKO
287.japanese: よかったじゃないですか！

288.speaker: PANDA
288.japanese: さすがだね ペンギンさん
288.english: Good job, Mr. Penguin. But then...

289.speaker: PENGUIN
289.japanese: ほら ペンジョリーナちゃんも ペン花ちゃんも頑張って！
289.english: Come on, Penjolina and Penka! You can do it!

291.speaker: PENGUIN
291.japanese: あと少しだよ ペン乃ちゃん ペンニュエルちゃん！
291.english: You're almost there, Penno and Penuelle!

293.speaker: POLAR BEAR
293.japanese: うまくいってるじゃない

298.speaker: PENKO
298.japanese: やだ ペンギンさんったら！
298.english: Oh, Mr. Penguin! Could you get me a riceball, Penna?

299.speaker: PENKO
299.japanese: えっ？ 私 ペン子よ

300.speaker: PENGUIN
300.japanese: えっ！？ だって ペン子ちゃんはキミでしょ？
300.english: What? But Penko should be... You, right? What? I'm Penmi!

302.speaker: PENKO
302.japanese: こっちの色のほうが似合うから 交換したの
302.english: We liked these colors better, so we traded. Right? Look, look!

303.speaker: PENGUIN
303.japanese: ちょっと待って！ なんで交換しちゃうの！？
303.english: Wait a minute! Why would you trade?!

304.speaker: PENGUIN
304.japanese: リボンの色で見分けてるのに
304.english: I'm telling you apart by the color of your ribbons!

305.speaker: PENGUIN
305.japanese: 区別つかなくなっちゃうでしょ！
305.english: Now I won't know who is who!

306.speaker: PENGUIN
306.japanese: いや その これは！

308.speaker: PENKOS
308.japanese: そういうことだったの
308.english: So that's how it is. Let's all calm down.

310.speaker: PENGUIN
310.japanese: ストップ！ ストップ ストップ！

313.speaker: PENGUIN
313.japanese: もう… キミたちってば

314.speaker: PENGUIN
314.japanese: もっとこう ちゃんと使える 何か別のアイディア頼むよ
314.english: Couldn't you give me a better idea that I can actually use?

315.speaker: POLAR BEAR
315.japanese: 普通に顔と名前を覚えたら？
315.english: How about you actually learn their names and faces?
